page.title: 16Railway Station,Paddock Wood
page.content: Paddock Wood Railway Station is situate along the line from London to coast, stopping at Folkstone,Dover,Deal and Sandwich. This is important for both passengers and for trade to the continent. The station was opened in 1842 and was then called Maidstone Road Station. It accounted for much of the growth of Paddock Wood at this time. It was the main source of employment and it brought people to settle in the village from the neighbouring towns and villages. There are four platforms and about ten trains per hour pass through. Five people are employed here and work in eight hour shifts. The first train leaves at 6.12 a.m. and the last train leaves at eleven minutes past midnight.
